etymology: a primitive root [rather identical with 07122 through the idea of accosting a person met]
avSummary: call 528, cried 98, read 38, proclaim 36, named 7, guests 4, invited 3, gave 3, renowned 3, bidden 2, preach 2, misc 11
definition:
1) to call, call out, recite, read, cry out, proclaim
    1a) (Qal)
        1a1) to call, cry, utter a loud sound
        1a2) to call unto, cry (for help), call (with name of God)
        1a3) to proclaim
        1a4) to read aloud, read (to oneself), read
        1a5) to summon, invite, call for, call and commission, appoint,
             call and endow
        1a6) to call, name, give name to, call by
    1b) (Niphal)
        1b1) to call oneself
        1b2) to be called, be proclaimed, be read aloud, be summoned,
             be named
    1c) (Pual) to be called, be named, be called out, be chosen
